subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Newton: Science as Worship
description: A micro-lesson that makes Newton: Science as Worship usable.

hook.text: Isaac Newton wrote more about theology than physics. For him, discovering natural laws was a way of reading God's mind.

buildup.text: Newton saw the universe as a divine machine. Understanding its mechanics meant understanding the Creator's design.

discovery.text: His Principia Mathematica described gravity as proof of God's order. The universe's elegance pointed to a designer.

twist.text: Newton also believed in alchemy, biblical prophecy, and the end times. His faith was intense and unorthodox.

climax.text: The man who invented modern physics was deeply religious. Science was born from the desire to understand God's creation.

punchline.text: Newton studied physics to read God's mind. Science began as worship.

quiz.question: How did Newton view his scientific work?
options: As a way of understanding God's design
